newsitem.title: ITALY: Gemina rises in Milan in heavy volume.
newsitem.headline: Gemina rises in Milan in heavy volume.

text.p: Italian financial holding group Gemina rose around four percent on the Milan bourse, after gaining over two percent on Wednesday, in volume of over 19 million shares, double yesterday's volume.
Traders said the renewed interest in the group stemmed from expectations of news out of a meeting with analysts due to have taken place on Wednesday but then put off.

"The postponement has made operators think Gemina might be about to make an announcement of some operation, perhaps a sale, as part of its streamlining programme and so are punting on the stock," one trader said.
There was press speculation Gemina might hold a board meeting on Friday but no one at the group was immediately available for comment.
At 1030 GMT, Gemina was quoted 3.45 percent up at 738 lire, off a session high of 745 lire.
